title: Peach Burrata Arugula Salad
description: A bright, no-cook salad combining peppery arugula, sweet-ripe peaches, creamy burrata and a tangy honey-lemon vinaigrette. Quick to assemble, it balances juicy fruit, soft cheese and crunchy toasted almonds for a refreshing summer starter or light meal.

ingredients.display_name: ripe peaches, halved and sliced (about 1/2-inch thick)
ingredients.notes: choose firm-ripe peaches; slice after halving
approx 100 g each; serve whole or torn

ingredients.display_name: raw whole almonds, toasted and roughly chopped
ingredients.notes: toast in a dry skillet until fragrant
can substitute maple syrup for vegan (note: diet change)

ingredients.display_name: balsamic glaze or reduction, for finishing
ingredients.notes: optional drizzle for sweetness and color

steps.text: Toast the almonds in a dry skillet over medium heat, shaking the pan frequently, until fragrant and lightly browned; transfer to a bowl to cool.
Prepare the peaches: wash, halve and pit them, then slice each half into 1/2-inch slices and set aside.
Make the vinaigrette: whisk together fresh lemon juice, honey, minced shallot, olive oil, salt and black pepper in a small bowl until emulsified; taste and adjust seasoning.
Assemble the salad base by placing the washed and dried arugula in a large shallow bowl or platter and gently tossing with a portion of the vinaigrette to lightly coat the leaves.
Arrange the peach slices over the dressed arugula, leaving space for the burrata; season peaches lightly with a pinch of salt and a grind of black pepper.
Place the burrata balls on the salad whole or tear them open to release the creamy center, distributing the cheese across the peaches and arugula.

Scatter the toasted chopped almonds and torn basil (if using) over the salad, drizzle with remaining vinaigrette and an optional thin stream of balsamic glaze, then finish with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately at room temperature so the burrata is creamy; provide extra vinaigrette on the side if desired.
